part_about.titel: Samarra and the imams of Samarra
part_about.description: The origin of the name (Samarra) goes back to the rest of the Aramaic names in Iraq that used to end with the missing letter Alif, such as (Karbala) (Baquba). ) and (Karbala) and became (Samarra and Karbala), while the letter Alif was replaced by the letter t from the name of the city of Baquba, and it became written (Baqubah) and it is known that the city of Samarra in most of the history of the Abbasid state was brilliant in...
